item.title: Warp, iTerm2, or Alacritty? My Terminal Tinkering Journey
item.description: 《Here After Us - Mayday》 Preface As a developer, whether running and debugging code locally or deploying and maintaining projects on remote servers, we can’t do without the terminal shown in the image below, which is the black window often seen in sci-fi movies. Operating systems generally have their default shells, such as “Powershell” on Windows, and bash or zsh on macOS and Linux systems. Systems with graphical interfaces also come with pre-installed terminal emulators, like “Terminal.
